body_html:
To clarify, it works if you take out this bit?

    for var in self.optimizer.variables():
      print('Adding {}'.format(var.name))
      setattr(self, var.name, var)

I don't see the purpose of that. There's already a dependency on the optimizer, right? Is this so they'll show up in model.variables?

    for var in self.optimizer.variables():
      print('Adding {}'.format(var.name))
      setattr(self, var.name, var)

I don't see the purpose of that. There's already a dependency on the optimizer, right? Is this so they'll show up in model.variables?
body:
To clarify, it works if you take out this bit?

```
    for var in self.optimizer.variables():
      print('Adding {}'.format(var.name))
      setattr(self, var.name, var)
```

I don't see the purpose of that. There's already a dependency on the optimizer, right? Is this so they'll show up in `model.variables`?
